duties_responsibilities.duty: Collect blood specimens by venipuncture or capillary puncture using age-specific criteria guidelines and following correct policy and procedures requirements.

Transport specimens using correct requirements (i.e. refrigerate, room temp, frozen, protect from light, etc.) and process and prepare specimens for delivery to correct laboratory departments for testing in a timely manner.
Demonstrate competency in the operation of Laboratory Information System, maintain and apply knowledge of Ethics and Compliance Standards.

Adhere to the laboratory’s quality control policies, maintain confidentiality of all patients, and assume responsibility for continuing education and professional development to maintain certification and/or license appropriate for assigned duties.
Acts as a reference/information source for areas outside the lab regarding specimen collection procedures.

education_certification.credential: High School Graduate / GED, Basic Cardiac Life Support, or CPR for Healthcare Providers, or Heart Saver CPR must be obtained within 30 days of employment start date. Certification in Phlebotomy required.
